intro: Cynometra laurentii, commonly known as the African satinwood, is a tropical tree native to Africa. It belongs to the family Sapotaceae and is characterized by its smooth, dark bark and elliptical leaves. The tree produces small, yellowish flowers followed by woody, spherical fruits containing flat, edible seeds. It is valued for its hard, durable wood used in construction and furniture. The plant also has traditional medicinal uses in some African cultures.
